::DarkMouse::

She saw the look on Quickstrike's face.  She could see that he 
disapproved of her choice in pets.  She smiled, "I know it's a little 
odd for a mouse like me to have a pet rat.  But Akura is a nice pet.  
he may even come in handy if I can train him right."  She left with 
the rat on her shoulder and went into the lab to fix up a cage for 
the rat.  She found the materials and started making the cage.

After a bit, she had a nice 2 foot, by 3 foot, by 3 foot cage 
complete with wheel and tunnels for Akura to run through.  She put 
him in the cage and took the cage to her console and set it next to 
the main screen.  She smiled and watched him run in his new home.  
Then she went about scanning again. Only this time, no rats were 
chewing on her wiring to mess it up.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Talon Harvilicz" <wilddance_mare@h...> 
wrote:
> Quickstrike:
> 
> 
> Quickstrike glared at Dark Mouse with one bright crimson optic 
squinted. He 
> thought it was rather odd to keep a pet rat, but everyone had their 
hobbies. 
> He frowned a little. Rats were more food to him than pets.
> 
> "Well, alright," he said lowly. "Jus' make sure t' keep 'im in that 
cage." 
> He looked at Stingtra. "We still goin'?"
